abstract: As it awaits the green light from federal antitrust regulators, Google disclosed last week in a government filing that it is putting new lobbying muscle, including a former high-ranking Justice Department antitrust lawyer, behind its proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of the online advertising firm DoubleClick.
lead_paragraph: As it awaits the green light from federal antitrust regulators, Google disclosed last week in a government filing that it is putting new lobbying muscle, including a former high-ranking Justice Department antitrust lawyer, behind its proposed $3.1 billion acquisition of the online advertising firm DoubleClick.

headline.main: Google Brings in Big Guns for DoubleClick Review
